intro: Strobilanthes salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of willow trees. The plant produces showy, clustered inflorescences with small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
